column5: I know this is a walleye site, but would like to change things up and take my son fishing smallmouth over Labor Day weekend. I know nothing is a guarantee, but would like recommendations for someplace where the odds are we would have pretty good action. Ideas within a couple of hours from Sioux Narrows would be ideal. Thanks for any info you could provide.

I'm surprised that you haven't gotten any responses. Check out Shoal Lake Lodge. I have never personally fished there, but it has received great reviews and I have friends who have gone there in the past. There was a similar post about smallmouth fishing just last month:https://www.walleyecentral.com/forums...d.php?t=477274
We've always done real well on the big LOW. (lake of the woods). Cedar lake south of perualt falls and English river north of Kenora.

Why not stay at Sioux Narrows? I am not sure that you would find a better spot. Hit the islands to the west of the bridge for close-in spots. Lots of lodging options. Tomahawk Resort is good and there are others in various price ranges . You could also camp at the provincial park or stay at the local motel. What kind of a place are you interested in?

I've done lots of research on smallmouth fishing in that area and I'm dying to fish Kishkutena. It's a fly-in -- probably a 15 minute hop from Sioux Narrows. I know Young's has an outpost there, and a couple of the air services as well...From what I've read and heard, it's about as close to a sure thing as you can get for smallmouth -- with lots of muskie as a bonus. I'm hoping to get up there in the next couple of years.
